name: Maximising Government incentives for renewable energy
location: This stream will take place in (room to be confirmed)
description: There has been much coverage about the Government’s handling of incentives for renewable energy.  The Feed in Tariff was so successful that it required a drastic readjustment as the take-up exceeded all expectations.  Now with the introduction more recently of the Renewable Heat Incentive and its staged application, this session asks how do incentives shape the market across the spectrum of green energy alternatives?  What impact do the incentives have on new homeowners looking for low-cost low carbon energy for their homes - as well as landlords, housing associations and social landlords, and house builders.

presentations.name: Strategies to incentivise community energy projects
presentations.speakers: Pete Capener, Chair, Bath and West Community Energy

presentations.name: RHI – microgen scale
presentations.speakers: Dave Sowden, Chief Executive, Micropower Council, and Secretary General, Micropower Europe
